intro: Streblosa pubescens, commonly known as the hairy streblosa, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
